body.p: Usually an editing session has the following stages which are repeated throughout the day:

ul.li: Clone/Checkout Branch From Remote Repository - Checkout a branch from the remote repository on which you want to work. Usually done only once.
Pull Content From Remote Repository - Obtain the latest content for the edited project branch.
Edit Content - The project is edited and modified in the current working copy.
Commit Content - Commit the changes to the local working copy.

Push Content To Remote Repository - Push from time to time the commits to the remote repository so that others can use them as well. You must always pull content from the repository before pushing to it.

section.title: Handling Conflicts
section.p: Conflicts are usually caused by changes made to the same resources modified by others in the meantime on the remote repository.
